Hey everyone, I just want to mention that some of the latest versions of RemoveWAT DO have malware in them.

This includes an (almost) unclosable keylogger.

I found a data.dat file in my Roaming folder last month and it contained every document I typed, every password entered, everything, all the way back from February. When I last used RemoveWAT. After rebooting from using RemoveWAT, you can use my tool to clean up in safe mode.

TPB.org/torrent/6539908

I can give anyone and everyone the source code, and can e-mail everyone my site which also has a DDL to the cleaner too.

Be safe everyone!

I also forgot to mention that once properly embedded in the system, this malware will try to spread through USB devices.

In order to prevent this, you will have to enable hidden files and folders, open any USB storage devices you have used on any cracked Windows computers, and look for a hidden "svchost.exe" and hidden "autorun.inf". If you open the autorun.inf file, it will have "run=svchost.exe" on one of the lines. When you plug the USB drive in, the svchost.exe will copy itself to the Roaming folder of the current user and run.

This is extremely hard to detect on Windows x86 (32 bit) machines. However, if you look in the TaskManager and sort by Image Name, you will see that one of the svchost.exes is running in 32 bit mode (svchost.exe*32).

Newer variants may have 64 bit versions of this, but it can always be detected if you go to your Roaming folder (my app also has this shortcut built-in) and see an svchost.exe sitting there, you've got it.
